data.title: Numap keys don't work on El Capitan
data.body:
From https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/983#issuecomment-221346786
From @cliffowen 

Again, I am using a Mac.. and using El Capitan (since I did not mention that before). The keyboard layout is ANSI US. I speculate the layout is correct though, as VMWare and Parallels both handle the keyboard properly. Actual keyboard is a Logitech Wave.

Oddly enough, Numpad + and - are fine (numpad_add and numpad_subtract). It's the numbers that are not correct. In the capture window, they report 0, 1, 2... rather than numpad0, numpad1, etc.

Here are a couple of the bindings I had set up and were working on the Mac on 1.0 that no longer work with 1.1.x. My primary goal is identical behavior between VS and VSC on PC and Mac.

```
{
    "key": "numpad9",
    "command": "cursorPageUp",
    "when": "editorTextFocus"
},
{
    "key": "shift+numpad8",
    "command": "cursorUpSelect",
    "when": "editorTextFocus"
},
```

data.title: Debugging is *painfully* slow when using readline.on
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.1.1
- OS Version:  OSX  10.11.2 (15C50)
- Using Nodejs 5.4.1 or 6.2.0

Steps to Reproduce:

`
const fs = require('fs');
const readline = require('readline');

const rl = readline.createInterface({
    input: fs.createReadStream('accounts')
});

rl.on('line', (account) => {
    console.log('checking account: ', account);
});
`

accounts file has a list of strings:
00133883
00281479
00287363
00289717
00290434
00290769
00297306
00297392
00332887
00371563
00513623
00513625
00513629
00514177
01012914
01023036
01027778
01029492
01086616
01117383
01117461
01117527
01117587
01125284
01152315
1. Set a breakpoint on the console.log inside rl.on....and debugger never reaches this line.

VS Code shows the error:  Request 'continue' was cancelled because Node.js is unresponsive.
1. if you limit the file to just 3 lines, it does reach the line, but stepping through the code is painfully slow.

data.title: Allow to launch terminal window without file extension.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make sure you are working with multiple monitor.
2. Launch VSCode and update setting in settings.json to powershell terminal without extension "exe".
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15515260/1c7b7be6-21a2-11e6-81a0-915c406082f2.png)
3. Launch terminal window by pressing CTRL+` and verify app behavior.

Actual: Terminal window launched but user can't perform any action. Mouse pointer is keep blinking and showing loading icon all the time. when hover over on terminal window.
Note: I observed this with powershell only for native command prompt cmd and cmd.exe both working properly.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15516088/0457208e-21a6-11e6-8ac9-7e621fefb8a0.png)

data.title: Lost my work on unix mount

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I have a mounted remote drive with sshfs.
I edit files from this drive with vscode.

At some moment the mount disconnected and then connected again.
When it was disconnected I tried to access one of my remote files in "vscode working files".

Unfortunately I do not remember exact sequence and I cannot repro. 
The fact is that after the mount restored, vscode showed me a version of the remote file that was older than version that I saved. I edited this old version and saved it. So I lost about one hour of my work. 

I know for sure that I saved newer version, because after saving I run tests on my remote box. I remember running tests on the newer version that was restored.

If you, guys, can find out how could it happen and fix, my trust to vscode will restore and I will continue using it.

I will be happy to give you as much details as you need, share my screen with you, and do tests for you.
Thank you!

data.title: PWD in terminal window is chopping off when changing vscode display position to different resolution (multi monitor scenario)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps:
1. Make sure you are working with multiple monitor.
2. Launch VSCode and update setting in settings.json to powershell terminal.
3. Launch terminal window and change VSCODe position to other monitor (From 1280x1024 to 1280x800) and make it full size.

Actual: Once user drag and drop vscode to other monitor then path for the present working directory is not displaying full path.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15514744/6ef727f6-219f-11e6-8184-c26484b67012.png)

Expected:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15514789/a6006046-219f-11e6-84d4-021b7f0a2ee4.png)

No solid repro for this unfortunately. What I recall doing (Ubuntu 16.04):
1. Copying:
   
   ```
   a {
     background-color: var(--css-var);
   }
   ```

2. <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>n</kbd>
3. Save as "b.scss"
4. Paste

data.title: When VSCode crashes it should automatically restart

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It seems this is a very frequent occurrence. It seems like this is a slow freeze crash, which means it happens when editor is left alone overnight.

I understand there is a bug to track but it seems related to the limitation of node giving only 1GB memory. Rather than showing the crash popup, how about just auto-restarting it to the state it was after 30 seconds?

data.body:

1. Open vs code
2. Press the tab key
3. Wait a second or two
4. Get control back
5. Go crazy as it won't happen again until a new instance is opened or an indeterminate amount of time has passed

data.title: contentprovider-sampler: remove 'out' folder from repository
data.body:
testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6675:
- Remove 'out' folder from contentprovider-sampler sample. The other samples do not have the generated code and maps either.
- The contentprovider-sampler does not have a '.vscode' folder with launch configuration. This is inconsistent with the other sample folders.

data.title: Revisit that preview editors show up under "Opened Editors"
data.body:
Some issues:
- for one it makes it very hard to double click on a file in the explorer to pin it because the first mouse down adds it already and pushes down the view
- then people are confused that the preview editor is open in one position but when you open another editor the preview editor might move up because that other editor was elsewhere
- Joao also does not like the italic decoration when you have tabs disabled
- so one proposal would be: only show italics when tabs are enabled and only show it in the tab itself
  (of course we would have to revisit where else we show the italic, e.g. Ctrl+Tab, Cmd+Alt+Tab)

data.title: Closing HTML tags with hyphens are not deindented properly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an HTML file
2. Type "someTag" and hit Tab, Enter
3. Closing tag is placed on newline at same indentation level as opening tag
4. On a new line, type "some-tag" and hit Tab, Enter
5. Closing tag is indented from opening tag

![hyphenated tags](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16612667/15508609/c48257e0-2195-11e6-9376-7e71915b2b8a.gif)

data.title: Sidebar pushed out of view when window is very small

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open vscode, do not have it full screen, have it just occupy a portion of the screen
2. open developer tools
3. open editors side by side -> layout get broken due to limited size

As you pointed out wokrbench is not aware that the developer tools got opened and thus the layout gets broken.

![screen shot 2016-05-24 at 15 48 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/15507897/aafe25fa-21cd-11e6-87bd-b85d1e5eed1d.png)

data.title: passing launch config without a 'type' attribute to 'vscode.startDebug' does not return an error
data.body:
testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6248:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0 alpha
- OS Version: OS X 10

Steps to Reproduce:
- use the setup from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6806
- remove the 'type' attribute
- run 'Hello' command

Observe:
no error is reported.

'type' is a mandatory attribute that should result in error if missing.
But it should be possible to omit attribute 'name' without error.

data.title: launching debug via 'vscode.startDebug' API does not work if there is the selected launch config doesn't match the debug type
data.body:
testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6248:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0 alpha
- OS Version: OS X 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Use the setup from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6806:
- make sure that running the 'Hello' command still launches the node debug session correctly.
- add this fake launch config to the launch.json:
  
  ``` ts
      {
          "name": "Fake",
          "request": "launch",
          "type": "fake"
      }
  ```
- in the drop down menu select 'Fake'
- run the 'Hello' command

Observe:

this error occurs:
![2016-05-24 15-56-22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/15506635/9d4f9ac4-21c8-11e6-8792-ab7bb39fdc5c.png)

Starting a debug session programmatically should not require to have a launch config with a corresponding debug type selected in the drop down menu.

code-alpha --install-extension: How to know the id
data.body:
Testing #6099

When installing an extension with `code-alpha --install-extension` I need to pass the id that includes publisher and name.
It's not easy to find that id out. Especially the publisher part is not mentioned on the marketplace page itself: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=donjayamanne.python
It is in the URL of that page though.

It would be good if it where as easy as described here
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/15506189/fd130920-21c6-11e6-8c12-6a2785110bd7.png)
